definition: the will of Heaven/the will of God
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.english: Do you see people who are spiritually unable to find their way back home?
sentences.chinese: 你是否看見靈命失喪的人無法歸家？

sentences.english: Pastor, where are the Our Daily Bread devotionals?
sentences.chinese: 牧師，靈脩手冊《靈命日糧》在哪裏？

sentences.english: I have felt the burden laid upon me to have a watch-care for your soul.
sentences.chinese: 我感到身負重任，對守護看顧你的靈命有負擔。
靈命的停滯會鏽蝕心靈。

sentences.english: Hidden manna speaks of secret nourishment for our spiritual lives.
sentences.chinese: 隱藏的嗎哪是喻意基督會幫助我們的靈命成長。

sentences.english: Only participation in the full life of a local church builds spiritual muscle.
sentences.chinese: 只有積極參加當地教會生活，靈命纔會增長。

sentences.english: To get better with age, get spiritually fit.
sentences.chinese: 要想越老越好，就追求靈命更高。

sentences.english: I asked God to make my spirit grow. God said, No.
sentences.chinese: 我求神使我的靈命長進，神說不。

sentences.english: Spiritual growth is sometimes tedious work, one small step at a time.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，靈命成長是冗長沉悶的工作，一次一小步。

definition: to be successful in every endeavor
trustworthy/reliable/to believe something to be true
one tiny clue reveals the general trend (idiom); small beginnings show how things will develop
virtue has its rewards (idiom); one good turn deserves another
to exhort (sb) to live a virtuous life (Buddhism)/to beg for alms
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
variant of 輾轉|辗转[zhan3 zhuan3]
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
